info.title: F5 Distributed Cloud Services API for ves.io.schema.tenant_management.managed_tenant
info.description:
Managed tenant objects are required for declaring intent to manage a tenant.
The tenant which is being managed is called a `Managed Tenant` or `MT`` and
the tenant which is initiating the management is called `Original Tenant` or `OT`.

A tenant can manage one or more tenants and tenant itself could be managed by other allowed tenant.
Explicit configuration is required to establish or allow management - ie, request to manage via
managed_tenant object configuration in OT and allowed to manage declaration via allowed_tenant
configuration in MT. This means reflexive and transitive relation are *NOT* supported or
such assumptions cannot be made.
  Reflexive - tenant A (OT) -> tenant B (MT) ==> Tenant B manage Tenant A
  Transitive - tenant A (OT) -> tenant B (MT) , tenant B (OT) -> tenant C (MT) ==> Tenant A manage Tenant C

While creating a managed_tenant configuration object, admin can choose existing
user group instance from the tenant and map it to groups in the managed tenant by specifying
managed tenant's group names. User in original tenant needs to be member of group specified in managed_tenant
configuration. Access into managed tenant will be granted once admin of managed tenant creates an allowed tenant
configuration including one or more groups specified in managed_tenant configuration.
Until admin of an MT creates corresponding allowed_tenant configuration, RBAC will deny access.

When User from OT tries to access managed tenant, group memberships will be taken from OT and
corresponding groups will be identified via the map configuration; and underlying roles for each
mapped group will be looked up from managed_tenant (MT) and evaluated for the API access.

This gives admin of managed tenant ability to have granular RBAC(Role Based Access Control) for all
user access from original tenant and admin of original tenant to control which user has access into
which managed tenant based on group assignment/membership.

This feature may not be enabled by default and will require subscribing to additional addon service
`Tenant Manangement` depending upon the tenant's plan

get.summary: Get List of Managed Tenant By User
get.description:
Get list of managed tenants that user have access to based on assigned membership.
This is an optimized list generated based on the requesting user's current group assignments
that will allow access to managed tenant.

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: search_keyword
parameters.description:
x-example: "value"
Search Keyword for filtering the Managed Tenant List.

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description:
x-example: "c5776a8e-bcae-4392-98d3-3556f4b9df1b"
PageStart will hold the UUID of the first item in the requested page.
Response will contain items upto count specified in PageLimit starting from  PageStart.
If this is empty then first page will be served.

parameters.name: page_limit
parameters.description:
x-example: "100"
PageLimit will hold the limit of items required per query.
Default value is set as 100

namespace

parameters.name: response_format
parameters.description:
The format in which the configuration object is to be fetched. This could be for example
    - in GetSpec form for the contents of object
    - in CreateRequest form to create a new similar object
    - to ReplaceRequest form to replace changeable values

Default format of returned resource
Response should be in CreateRequest format
Response should be in ReplaceRequest format
Response should be in StatusObject(s) format
Response should be in format of GetSpecType
Response should have other objects referring to this object
Response should have deleted and disabled objects referrred by this object

customer_supportAttachmentType.description:
Attachment represents a single support ticket comment attachment. Attachment are normally not store with the ticket itself,
they represent a handle in the third party, so the contact can be retrieved omn demand.
customer_supportAttachmentType.title: Attachment

attachment.description:
Any binary attachment (such as screenshots, plain text files, PDFs) encoded as base64 if used over HTTP.

Example: ` "dGVzdCBhdHRhY2htZW50"`
attachment.title: Binary attachment

content_type.description:
Mime content type of the attachment. Helps the UI to properly display the data.

Example: ` "application/pdf"`
content_type.title: Content type

filename.description:
Filename of the attachment as provided by the caller.

Example: ` "attachment.pdf"`
filename.title: Filename of the attachment

tp_id.description:
Optional ID as assigned by the 3rd party actually storing the data.

Example: ` "1234"`
tp_id.title: 3rd party ID

customer_supportCloseResponse.description: Gives details of result of closing a customer support ticket.
customer_supportCloseResponse.title: Close response
customer_supportCloseResponse.x-displayname: Response to closing a customer support ticket

customer_supportCommentResponse.description: Gives details of result of adding a customer support ticket.
customer_supportCommentResponse.title: Comment response
customer_supportCommentResponse.x-displayname: Response to adding of new customer support ticket comment

customer_supportCommentType.description:
Comment represents a single comment on an issue. It contains information like name of the person commenting, timestamp and the comment itself.
Customers usually download all comments on an issue which resembles a conversation on an issue.
customer_supportCommentType.title: Comment

attachment_ids.description:
Third party id of any attachment related to this ticket comment

Example: ` "12345"`
attachment_ids.title: Third party attachment ID

attachments_info.description: Information about any attachments (such as screenshots, plain text files) the comment can have.
attachments_info.title: Attachments information

author_email.description:
Email of the author of the comment

Example: ` "john.smith@volterra.io"`
author_email.title: Email

author_name.description:
Author of the comment (as a name)

Example: ` "John Smith"`
author_name.title: Author

html.description:
Comment body as HTML Example: ` "

Looking good

"`
html.title: HTML text

plain_text.description:
Comment body as plain text

Example: ` "Looking good"`
plain_text.title: Plain text

customer_supportEscalationResponse.description: Any error that may occurred during escalating of a ticket
customer_supportEscalationResponse.title: Escalation response

customer_supportPriorityResponse.description: Gives details of result of changing priority a customer support ticket.
customer_supportPriorityResponse.title: Change priority response
customer_supportPriorityResponse.x-displayname: Response to changing of priority of a customer support ticket

customer_supportReopenResponse.description: Gives details of result of reopening a customer support ticket.
customer_supportReopenResponse.title: Reopen response
customer_supportReopenResponse.x-displayname: Response to reopening a customer support ticket

customer_supportSupportService.description:
Indicates the list of support service

Unknown Support Service
Account Protection Support Service
Administration Support Service
Application Traffic Insight Support Service
Audit Logs & Alerts Support Service
Authentication Intelligence Support Service
Billing Support Service
Client Side Defense Support Service
Cloud & Edge Sites Support Service
deprecated: use SS_MULTI_CLOUD_NETWORK_CONNECT instead
DDOS & Transit Support Service
Deprecated: use SS_ROUTED_DDOS instead
Distributed Apps Support Service
DNS Management Support Service
LoadBalancers Support Service
deprecated: use SS_MULTI_CLOUD_APP_CONNECT instead
Shared Configuration Support Service
Web App & API Protection Support Service
Other Support Service
Bot Defense Support Service
Content delivery network Support Service
Observability Support Service
Delegated Access Support Service
Networking & security across clouds, edge and on-premises
Connect apps across clouds, edge and on-premises using Load Balancers
BIG-IP Access Policy Manager (APM)
Data Intelligence Support Service
NGINX One Support Service
Web App Scanning Support Service
Routed DDoS Support Service
Mobile App Shield protects mobile apps from reverse engineering, tampering and malware
customer_supportSupportService.title: SupportService

customer_supportSupportTicketPriority.description:
Support ticket priority helps understand importance of the ticket and focus
more on more critical issues.

Unknown/empty priority
Normal priority issue
High priority issue
Urgent priority issue
customer_supportSupportTicketPriority.title: SupportTicketPriority

customer_supportSupportTicketStatus.description:
State of the ticket so the customers know if the problem is being looked into

Unknown or empty support ticket status
Indicates a new ticket, waiting to be assigned to an agent
Indicates an open issues, actively being looked into
Indicates a pending issue, an open issue not actively being looked into
Indicates on issue that on-hold, waiting for more information
Indicates a solved issue, waiting for customer's confirmation
Indicates a closed issue, resolved and customer approved
Indicates a failed ticket, a failed ticket didn't make it into Zendesk and a customer should create new one instead
customer_supportSupportTicketStatus.title: SupportTicketStatus

customer_supportSupportTicketType.description:
Several types of issues are supported, such as problems, questions.

Unknown or empty ticket type
Indicates a problem (e.g. misconfiguration)
Indicates a task (a request to do something)
Indicates a question (billing, services related)
Indicates an incident (something is not working)
Indicates a technical support ticket
Indicates an account support ticket
Indicates an Incident support ticket
customer_supportSupportTicketType.title: SupportTicketType

customer_supportSupportTopic.description:
Support Topic indicates the list of topics for service tickets

Unknown/empty priority
ACCOUNT_SUPPORT_TOPIC_ACCESS_REQUEST
ACCOUNT_SUPPORT_TOPIC_ACCOUNT
ACCOUNT_SUPPORT_TOPIC_BILLING
ACCOUNT_SUPPORT_TOPIC_BILLING_PLAN_CHANGE
ACCOUNT_SUPPORT_TOPIC_PUBLIC_IP
ACCOUNT_SUPPORT_TOPIC_QUOTA_INCREASE
ACCOUNT_SUPPORT_TOPIC_RMA
ACCOUNT_SUPPORT_TOPIC_TAX_EXEMPT_VERIFICATION
ACCOUNT_SUPPORT_TOPIC_OTHERS
TECHNICAL_SUPPORT_TOPIC_CONFIGURATION_CHANGES
TECHNICAL_SUPPORT_TOPIC_ERROR_MESSAGE
TECHNICAL_SUPPORT_TOPIC_NEW_CONFIGURATION
TECHNICAL_SUPPORT_TOPIC_PRODUCT_QUESTION
TECHNICAL_SUPPORT_TOPIC_TROUBLESHOOTING
TECHNICAL_SUPPORT_TOPIC_OTHERS
INCIDENT_SUPPORT_TOPIC_LATENCY
INCIDENT_SUPPORT_TOPIC_PERFORMANCE_DEGRADATION
INCIDENT_SUPPORT_TOPIC_PARTIAL_OUTAGE
INCIDENT_SUPPORT_TOPIC_COMPLETE_OUTAGE
INCIDENT_SUPPORT_TOPIC_OTHERS
TASK_TOPIC_PLAN_TRANSITION
PROBLEM_TOPIC_SUPPORT_ALERT
QUESTION_TOPIC_INFRASTRUCTURE
TECHNICAL_SUPPORT_TOPIC_DELEGATED_DOMAIN_MIGRATION
customer_supportSupportTopic.title: SupportTopic

ioschemaEmpty.description:
x-displayName: "Empty"
This can be used for messages where no values are needed
ioschemaEmpty.title: Empty

ioschemaErrorCode.description:
Union of all possible error-codes from system

 - EOK: No error
 - EPERMS: Permissions error
 - EBADINPUT: Input is not correct
 - ENOTFOUND: Not found
 - EEXISTS: Already exists
 - EUNKNOWN: Unknown/catchall error
 - ESERIALIZE: Error in serializing/de-serializing
 - EINTERNAL: Server error
 - EPARTIAL: Partial error
ioschemaErrorCode.title: ErrorCode

ioschemaObjectRefType.description:
This type establishes a 'direct reference' from one object(the referrer) to another(the referred).
Such a reference is in form of tenant/namespace/name for public API and Uid for private API
This type of reference is called direct because the relation is explicit and concrete (as opposed
to selector reference which builds a group based on labels of selectee objects)
ioschemaObjectRefType.title: ObjectRefType

kind.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then kind will hold the referred object's kind (e.g. "route")

Example: ` "virtual_site"`
kind.title: kind

name.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then name will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) name.

Example: ` "contactus-route"`
name.title: name

namespace.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then namespace will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) namespace.

Example: ` "ns1"`
namespace.title: namespace

tenant.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then tenant will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) tenant.

Example: ` "acmecorp"`
tenant.title: tenant

uid.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then uid will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) uid.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

managed_tenantDeleteRequest.title: DeleteRequest is used to delete a managed_tenant

fail_if_referred.description: Fail the delete operation if this object is being referred by other objects
fail_if_referred.title: fail_if_referred

name.description:
Name of the configuration object

Example: ` "name"`
name.title: name

Namespace in which the configuration object is present

Example: ` "ns1"`
namespace.title: namespace

managed_tenantGetManagedTenantListResp.title: GetManagedTenantListResp

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

schemaConditionType.description:
Conditions are used in the object status to describe the current state of the
object, e.g. Ready, Succeeded, etc.
schemaConditionType.title: ConditionType

hostname.description: Hostname of the instance of the site that sent the status
hostname.title: hostname

last_update_time.description: Last time the condition was updated
last_update_time.title: last_update_time

reason.description:
x-reason: "Insufficient memory in data plane"
 A human readable string explaining the reason for reaching this condition

Example: ` "value"`
reason.title: reason

service_name.description: Name of the service that sent the status
service_name.title: service name

status.description:
Status of the condition
 "Success" Validtion has succeded. Requested operation was successful.
 "Failed"  Validation has failed.
 "Incomplete" Validation of configuration has failed due to missing configuration.
 "Installed" Validation has passed and configuration has been installed in data path or K8s
 "Down" Configuration is operationally down. e.g. down interface
 "Disabled" Configuration is administratively disabled i.e. ObjectMetaType.Disable = true.
 "NotApplicable" Configuration is not applicable e.g. tenant service_policy_set(s) in system namespace are not applicable on REs

Example: ` "Failed"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.in: [\"Success\",\"Failed\",\"Incomplete\",\"Installed\",\"Down\",\"Disabled\",\"NotApplicable\"]
status.title: status

type.description:
Type of the condition
 "Validation" represents validation user given configuration object
 "Operational" represents operational status of a given configuration object

Example: ` "Operational"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.in: [\"Validation\",\"Operational\"]
type.title: type

schemaErrorType.description: Information about a error in API operation
schemaErrorType.title: ErrorType

message.description:
A human readable string of the error

Example: ` "value"`
message.title: message

schemaInitializerType.description: Initializer is information about an initializer that has not yet completed.
schemaInitializerType.title: InitializerType

name.description: name of the service that is responsible for initializing this object.
name.title: name

schemaInitializersType.description: Initializers tracks the progress of initialization of a configuration object
schemaInitializersType.title: InitializersType

pending.description:
Pending is a list of initializers that must execute in order before this object is initialized.
 When the last pending initializer is removed, and no failing result is set, the initializers
 struct will be set to nil and the object is considered as initialized and visible to all
 clients.
pending.title: pending

This is the name of configuration object. It has to be unique within the namespace.
 It can only be specified during create API and cannot be changed during replace API.
 The value of name has to follow DNS-1035 format.

schemaStatusMetaType.description: StatusMetaType is metadata that all status must have.
schemaStatusMetaType.title: StatusMetaType

creation_timestamp.description:
creation_timestamp is when the status object was created. It is used to find/tie-break
 for latest status object from same origin
creation_timestamp.title: creation_timestamp

creator_class.description:
Class of creator which created this StatusObject. This will be service's DNS FQDN.
 This will be set by the system based on client certificate information.

Example: ` "ver.re1.int.ves.io"`
creator_class.title: creator_class

creator_id.description:
ID of creator which created this StatusObject. This will be a concrete identifier for service (e.g.
 identifying the environment also). This will be set by the system based on client certificate
 information

Example: ` "ver-instance-1"`
creator_id.title: creator_id

status_id.description:
status_id is a field used by the generator to distinguish (if necessary) between two status
 objects for the same config object from the same site and same service and potentially same
 daemon(creator-id)
status_id.title: status_id

uid.description:
uid is the unique in time and space value for a StatusObject.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

vtrp_id.description: Origin of this status exchanged by VTRP.
vtrp_id.title: vtrp_id

vtrp_stale.description: Indicate whether mars deems this object to be stale via graceful restart timer information
vtrp_stale.title: vtrp_stale

schemaStatusPublishType.description:
StatusPublishType is all possible publish operations on a StatusObject

 - STATUS_DO_NOT_PUBLISH: Do Not Publish

Do not propagate this status to user. This could be because status is only informational
 - STATUS_PUBLISH: Publish

Propagate this status up to user as it might be actionable
schemaStatusPublishType.title: StatusPublishType

schemaStatusType.description: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.
schemaStatusType.title: StatusType

code.description:
Suggested HTTP return code for this status, 0 if not set.

Example: ` "0"`
code.title: code

reason.description:
A human-readable description of why this operation is in the
 "Failure" status. If this value is empty there
 is no information available.

Example: ` "value"`
reason.title: reason

status.description:
Status of the operation.
 One of: "Success" or "Failure".

Example: ` "value"`
status.title: status

schemaSystemObjectGetMetaType.description:
SystemObjectGetMetaType is metadata generated or populated by the system for all persisted objects and
cannot be updated directly by users.
schemaSystemObjectGetMetaType.title: SystemObjectGetMetaType

creation_timestamp.description:
CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was
 created. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations.
 Clients may not set this value. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.
creation_timestamp.title: creation_timestamp

creator_class.description:
A value identifying the class of the user or service which created this configuration object.

Example: ` "value"`
creator_class.title: creator_class

creator_id.description:
A value identifying the exact user or service that created this configuration object

Example: ` "value"`
creator_id.title: creator_id

deletion_timestamp.description:
DeletionTimestamp is RFC 3339 date and time at which this resource will be deleted. This
 field is set by the server when a graceful deletion is requested by the user, and is not
 directly settable by a client. The resource is expected to be deleted (no longer visible
 from resource lists, and not reachable by name) after the time in this field, once the
 finalizers list is empty. As long as the finalizers list contains items, deletion is blocked.
 Once the deletionTimestamp is set, this value may not be unset or be set further into the
 future, although it may be shortened or the resource may be deleted prior to this time.
 For example, a user may request that a pod is deleted in 30 seconds. The Kubelet will react
 by sending a graceful termination signal to the containers in the pod. After that 30 seconds,
 the Kubelet will send a hard termination signal (SIGKILL) to the container and after cleanup,
 remove the pod from the API. In the presence of network partitions, this object may still
 exist after this timestamp, until an administrator or automated process can determine the
 resource is fully terminated.
 If not set, graceful deletion of the object has not been requested.

 Populated by the system when a graceful deletion is requested.
 Read-only.
deletion_timestamp.title: deletion_timestamp

finalizers.description:
Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry
 is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry
 from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries
 in this list can only be removed.

Example: ` "value"`
finalizers.title: finalizers

labels.description:
Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize
 (scope and select) objects as chosen by the operator or software. Values here can be interpreted
 by software(backend or frontend) to enable certain behavior e.g. things marked as soft-deleted(restorable).

Example: ` "'ves.io/soft-deleted''true'"`
labels.title: labels

modification_timestamp.description:
ModificationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was
 last modified.
modification_timestamp.title: modification_timestamp

object_index.description:
Unique index for the object. Some objects need a unique integer index to be allocated
 for each object type. This field will be populated for all objects that need it and will
 be zero otherwise.

Example: ` "0"`
object_index.title: object_index

tenant.description:
Tenant to which this configuration object belongs to. The value for this is found from
 presented credentials.

Example: ` "acmecorp"`
tenant.title: tenant

uid.description:
uid is the unique in time and space value for this object. It is generated by
 the server on successful creation of an object and is not allowed to change on Replace
 API. The value of is taken from uid field of ObjectMetaType, if provided.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

schemaViewRefType.title: ViewRefType

Kind of the view object

Example: ` "http_proxy"`
kind.title: kind

When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then name will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) name.

Example: ` "contactus-route"`

namespace.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then namespace will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) namespace.

Example: ` "ns1"`
namespace.title: namespace

UID of the view object

Example: ` "f3744323-1adf-4aaa-a5dc-0707c1d1bd82"`
uid.title: uid

schemacustomer_supportCreateRequest.description: This is the input message of the 'Create' RPC
schemacustomer_supportCreateRequest.title: CreateRequest is used to create an instance of customer_support

schemacustomer_supportCreateSpecType.description: Creates a new customer support ticket in our customer support provider system.
schemacustomer_supportCreateSpecType.title: Create issue specification

category.description:
ticket area further narrows down the ticket - infrastructure, application,
 dashboards can be examples.


Example: ` "infrastructure"`
category.title: Deprecated

comments.description:
Comments are all public comments on an issue. They're usually conversation between the support personnel and the customer.

Example: ` ["I'm looking into it", "Thanks", "Fixed, can you please retry?", "It works!", "Thanks, closing the issue"]`

description.description:
customer's description of the issue (free text)

Example: ` "Hello support,  I cannot login to my account. Can you please look into it. Thank you, John"`
description.x-ves-example: Hello support,  I cannot login to my account. Can you please look into it. Thank you, John

ongoing.description: Ongoing is a flag that indicates whether the issue is ongoing or not.

product_data.description:
Product data is a free text field that can be used to describe the issue in more detail.

Example: ` "Happening in the loreimpsum namespace and impacts most of our sites"`
product_data.x-ves-example: Happening in the loreimpsum namespace and impacts most of our sites

relates_to.description: Optional reference to any original ticket in case the ticket being created is a followup.
relates_to.x-displayname: Ticket which this one relates to

subject.description:
subject of the ticket

Example: ` "Problem logging into account"`

timeline.description:
Timeline is a free text field that can be used to describe the issue in more detail.

Example: ` "Both LBs have been down since noon on Jan 5, 2022."`
timeline.x-ves-example: Both LBs have been down since noon on Jan 5, 2022.

tp_id.description:
ID assigned to this ticket by our support provider.

Example: ` "123"`

schemacustomer_supportErrorCode.description:
ErrorCode is used to know the specific reason for customer support operation failures

 - EUNKNOWN: an unknown error occurred
 - EOK: Successful operation
 - E_NOT_CLOSED: Customer support ticket not closed
 - E_NOT_OPEN: Customer support ticket not open
 - E_NOT_ELIGIBLE: Customer is not eligible for this operation (i.e. when escalating a ticket then this indicates customer not being enterprise)
 - E_NOT_NOT_FOUND: Support ticket couldn't be found.
schemacustomer_supportErrorCode.title: error code

schemacustomer_supportGetSpecType.description: Support ticket representation we display to customers. There's much more information associated with a ticker but this maybe sensitive/irrelevant.
schemacustomer_supportGetSpecType.title: Get issue specification

author_name.description:
Author of the comment (as a name)

Example: ` "John Smith"`

category.description:
ticket area further narrows down the ticket - infrastructure, application,
 dashboards can be examples.


Example: ` "infrastructure"`
category.title: Deprecated

comments.description:
Comments are all public comments on an issue. They're usually conversation between the support personnel and the customer.

Example: ` ["I'm looking into it", "Thanks", "Fixed, can you please retry?", "It works!", "Thanks, closing the issue"]`

custom_fields.description:
any custom fields (read only). custom fields have to be defined first before they're used.
 custom fields have no direct impact on the issue but help to better categorize issues.

Example: ` "custom-field-id:custom-field-value"`

description.description:
customer's description of the issue (free text)

Example: ` "Hello support,  I cannot login to my account. Can you please look into it. Thank you, John"`
description.x-ves-example: Hello support,  I cannot login to my account. Can you please look into it. Thank you, John

escalated.description:
Indicates escalated ticket - i.e. a ticket its priority has been increased to PRIORITY_URGENT and L1 support has been notified of it.
 only existing enterprise customer tickets with priority other then PRIORITY_URGENT can be escalated

followups.description:
Optional reference to followup tickets. It only applies to closed tickets and points to any ticket that is open as a followup to this closed ticket.
 Used in situations when the original ticket has been closed but the issue occurred again or a new problem occurred in relation to this closed ticket.

ongoing.description: Ongoing is a flag that indicates whether the issue is ongoing or not.

product_data.description:
Product data is a free text field that can be used to describe the issue in more detail.

Example: ` "Happening in the loreimpsum namespace and impacts most of our sites"`
product_data.x-ves-example: Happening in the loreimpsum namespace and impacts most of our sites

relates_to.description: Optional reference to any original ticket in case the ticket being created is a followup.
relates_to.x-displayname: Ticket which this one relates to

subject.description:
subject of the ticket

Example: ` "Problem logging into account"`

tags.description:
tags help to further categorize issues (read-only field)

Example: ` "UAM,UI"`

timeline.description:
Timeline is a free text field that can be used to describe the issue in more detail.

Example: ` "Both LBs have been down since noon on Jan 5, 2022."`
timeline.x-ves-example: Both LBs have been down since noon on Jan 5, 2022.

tp_id.description:
ID assigned to this ticket by our support provider.

Example: ` "123"`

update_at.description:
Date of the last modification

Example: ` "01-01-1970T00:00:00Z"`

via.description:
via describes the way of a ticket reaching us (read-only)

Example: ` "['channel':'web', 'source''{}']"`

By default a summary of customer_support is returned in 'List'. By setting
'report_fields' in the ListRequest more details of each item can be got.

List of group names in managed tenant (MT).
 Note - To properly establish access, admin of managed tenant need to create corresponding Allowed Tenant

tenant_managementStatus.description:
Status is to identify the status of the managed tenant configuration.

 - UNKNOWN: UNKNOWN
Unknown status of the configuration.
 - NOT_APPLICABLE: Not Applicable
The status is not applicable for the managed tenant configuration.
 - PENDING: Pending
The configuration is incomplete.
 - ACTIVE: Active
The tenant configuration is active.
 - MANAGED_TENANT_DISABLED: Managed Tenant Disabled
Managed Tenant is disabled.
 - ORIGINAL_TENANT_DISABLED: Operating Tenant Disabled
Operating Tenant is disabled.
tenant_managementStatus.title: Status

tenant is active

tenant is about to be deleted

List of local user group association to user groups in the managed tenant specified in the tenant_choice.

  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true

tenant_id.description:
Exclusive with []
 Specify the Tenant ID of the existing tenant which needs to be managed.
 User can select Tenant ID from dropdown if managed tenant has already configured delegated access
 or manually input the Tenant ID if managed tenant configuration will happen in future.

Example: ` "company-s4543dsa"`

tenant_managementmanaged_tenantGetRespon.description:
x-displayName: "Get Response Format"
This is the various forms that can be requested to be sent in the GetResponse

 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_DEFAULT: x-displayName: "Default Format"
Default format of returned resource
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_FOR_CREATE: x-displayName: "Create request Format"
Response should be in CreateRequest format
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_FOR_REPLACE: x-displayName: "Replace request format"
Response should be in ReplaceRequest format
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_STATUS: x-displayName: "Status format"
Response should be in StatusObject(s) format
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_READ: x-displayName: "GetSpecType format"
Response should be in format of GetSpecType
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_REFERRING_OBJECTS: x-displayName: "Referring Objects"
Response should have other objects referring to this object
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_BROKEN_REFERENCES: x-displayName: "Broken Referred Objects"
Response should have deleted and disabled objects referrred by this object
tenant_managementmanaged_tenantGetRespon.title: GetResponseFormatCode

tenant_managementmanaged_tenantGetSpecTy.description: Get managed_tenant reads a given object from storage backend for metadata.namespace.
tenant_managementmanaged_tenantGetSpecTy.title: Get managed tenant

groups.description:
List of local user group association to user groups in the managed tenant specified in the tenant_choice.

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.max_items: 16
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true

tenant_id.description:
Exclusive with []
 Specify the Tenant ID of the existing tenant which needs to be managed.
 User can select Tenant ID from dropdown if managed tenant has already configured delegated access
 or manually input the Tenant ID if managed tenant configuration will happen in future.

Example: ` "company-s4543dsa"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 256

tenant_managementmanaged_tenantListRespo.description: This is the output message of 'List' RPC.
tenant_managementmanaged_tenantListRespo.title: ListResponse is the collection of managed_tenant

errors.description: Errors(if any) while listing items from collection
errors.title: errors

items.description: items represents the collection in response
items.title: items

tenant_managementmanaged_tenantListRespo.description:
By default a summary of managed_tenant is returned in 'List'. By setting
'report_fields' in the ListRequest more details of each item can be got.
tenant_managementmanaged_tenantListRespo.title: ListResponseItem is an individual item in a collection of managed_tenant

annotations.description: The set of annotations present on this managed_tenant
annotations.title: annotations

description.description: The description set for this managed_tenant
description.title: description

disabled.description: A value of true indicates managed_tenant is administratively disabled
disabled.title: disabled

labels.description: The set of labels present on this managed_tenant
labels.title: labels

name.description:
The name of this managed_tenant

Example: ` "name"`
name.title: name

namespace.description:
The namespace this item belongs to

Example: ` "ns1"`
namespace.title: namespace

status_set.description: The status reported by different services for this configuration object
status_set.title: status

tenant.description:
The tenant this item belongs to

Example: ` "acmecorp"`
tenant.title: tenant

uid.description:
The unique uid of this managed_tenant

Example: ` "d27938ba-967e-40a7-9709-57b8627f9f75"`
uid.title: uid

tenant_managementmanaged_tenantReplaceSp.description:
Replaces attributes of a managed_tenant configuration.
Update of existing tenant_choice selection is not supported but user may update existing group assignments.
tenant_managementmanaged_tenantReplaceSp.title: Replace Managed Tenant

List of local user group association to user groups in the managed tenant specified in the tenant_choice.

viewsLinkRefType.description:
LinkRefType
This message defines a reference to hyperlink that can be accessed via web.

href.description:
Referred link's location. This can be treated as equivalent of href in html.

Example: ` "https://f5.com/link/resource_a"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 512
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.min_len: 1
href.title: HyperlinkRef

name.description:
Name to use for displaying above link in href

Example: ` "Resource A"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 256
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.min_len: 1
name.title: Name
